data.text: @NataliaHodgins @ElizaCharley @MEActNet @itsbodypolitic I don't know. But if you have any ideas happy to help out! I'll reach out if I think of anything too 🙌
@NataliaHodgins @jan_nahlinke @MEActNet @itsbodypolitic Good point. Would love to still jump on a call with you if you’re up to it later this week. I’ll DM you my What’s App :)
@ElizaCharley @jan_nahlinke @MEActNet @itsbodypolitic Wondering how we replicate their advocacy here.

@ElizaCharley @jan_nahlinke 100%, it’s all about the individual journalist writing the story & their level of understanding. I’m interested in why the US media is treating this so differently & know a significant amount of work went on in the background by @MEActNet and @itsbodypolitic to ensure accuracy.
@maddydaisyr I hate that articles like that have the potential to do so much harm.
@NataliaHodgins It was terrible! Especially the reference to graded exercise therapy… 🙃

@NataliaHodgins @jan_nahlinke I haven’t read this one yet and not sure if I have it in me to read it today.  Interesting to observe though, how even the same publication that publishes researched/informed pieces about MECFS, can immediately publish the opposite  1/2
@NataliaHodgins Ugh yes 😞 That was a shocker today 💔
@JasperPeachSays Absolutely. The depth of knowledge on these topics combined with lived experience, gives us such a unique perspective.
